alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 12:17AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Randolph, southeastern Lewis, Braxton, Upshur and northern Webster Counties through 100 AM EST... At 1216 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sutton, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sutton, Gassaway, Holly River State Park, Rock Cave, Flatwoods, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Alexander, Eden, Helvetia, Pickens, Cleveland, Little Birch, Hacker Valley, Kanawha Head, Ireland, French Creek, Erbacon, Diana, Alton and Exchange. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 56 and 76. Route 19 between mile markers 64 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur
